item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "By the time you swear you're his, Shivering and sighing. And he vows his passion is, Infinite, undying. Lady make note of this -- One of you is lying." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They sicken of the calm who know the storm." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The first thing I do in the morning is brush my teeth and sharpen my tongue." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I'm never going to accomplish anything; that's perfectly clear to me. I'm never going to be famous. My name will never be writ large on the roster of Those Who Do Things. I don't do anything. Not one single thing. I used to bite my nails, but I don't even do that any more." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Ducking for apples -- change one letter and it's the story of my life." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "She was pleased to have him come and never sorry to see him go." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "<b>Résumé</b> Razors pain you, Rivers are damp, Acids stain you, And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful, Nooses give, Gas smells awful. You might as well live." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"I had been fed, in my youth, a lot of old wives' tales about the way men would instantly forsake a beautiful woman to flock around a brilliant one. It is but fair to say that, after getting out in the world, I had never seen this happen."
[From a column dated November 17, 1928]" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take me or leave me; or, as is the usual order of things, both." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Time doth flit; oh shit." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I might repeat to myself, slowly and soothingly, a list of quotations beautiful from minds profound; if I can remember any of the damn things." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Four be the things I'd have been better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Men seldom make passes at girls who wear glasses." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "A little bad taste is like a nice dash of paprika." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Don't look at me in that tone of voice." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take care of the luxuries and the necessities will take care of themselves." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "So, you're the man who can't spell 'fuck.'" Dorothy Parker to Norman Mailer after publishers had convinced Mailer to replace the word with a euphemism, 'fug,' in his 1948 book, "The Naked and the Dead." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"There's a hell of a distance between wise-cracking and wit. Wit has truth in it; wise-cracking is simply calisthenics with words."
[<i>Interview, The Paris Review</i>, Summer 1956]" -- Dorothy Parker
